title: CreativeWorkAssertion
description: Indicates the asset is a creative work (Schema.org).

@context.description: Should include 'https://schema.org' plus any additional context if needed.

@type.description: Indicates this is a schema.org CreativeWork

url.description: Canonical URL for the creative work.

name.description: The name or title of the creative work.

headline.description: Headline of the article, book, or other creative work.

description.description: A short summary describing the creative work.

creator.description: The creator(s)/author(s) of this work. Could be Person or Organization.

author.description: Synonym for creator, but also can be Person or Organization.

publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.

dateModified.description: Date/time this work was most recently modified (ISO 8601).

license.description: A license document that applies to this content (URI or an object).

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content.

genre.description: Genre of the creative work (string or array of strings).

inLanguage.description: Primary language of the creative work (BCP-47 or ISO 639 code).

contentRating.description: Official rating of the content, e.g. MPAA PG-13.

isPartOf.description: Indicates a parent creative work that this is a part of.

exampleOfWork.description: A work that this is an example/instance of.

thumbnailUrl.description: URL for a thumbnail image relevant to this creative work.

image.description: An image of the creative work (URL or ImageObject).

about.description: The subject matter of this content (Thing, or array of Thing).

text.description: The textual content of this creative work if applicable.

copyrightHolder.description: The entity holding the legal copyright to the work. Usually Person or Organization.

copyrightYear.description: Year of first assertion of copyright.

accessMode.description: Indicates the primary way an individual can access or use the content (e.g., 'visual', 'textual').

accessModeSufficient.description: A list of ways sufficient to understand or use the content, e.g., ['textual','visual'].

PersonOrOrg.description: Represents a Person or an Organization from schema.org

Person.description: Represents an individual person, based on schema.org/Person

@type.description: Indicates this object is a schema.org Person

name.description: Full name of the person, e.g. 'Alice Smith'

additionalName.description: Middle name(s) or additional name(s). Can be a string or array of strings.

jobTitle.description: The person's job title, e.g., 'Software Engineer'

affiliation.description: Organizations that this person is affiliated with

worksFor.description: Organizations for which the person works

url.description: URL of a web page for this person

sameAs.description: URL(s) indicating an unambiguous reference to the person's identity (e.g., Wikipedia, LinkedIn)

birthDate.description: Person's date of birth in ISO8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)

image.description: Image(s) depicting this person (URL string or schema.org ImageObject).

identifier.description: Could be an external ID or an object with more ID details.

ContactPoint.description: Contact information for a person or organization

contactType.description: A brief description of what the contact is for (e.g. 'customer service').

areaServed.description: The geographic area where this contact point can provide service.

Organization.description: Represents an organization, based on schema.org/Organization

@type.description: Indicates this object is a schema.org Organization

name.description: The official (common) name of the organization.

legalName.description: Formal, legal name if different from 'name'.

url.description: A URL for the organization, e.g. corporate homepage.

identifier.description: An external or internal ID referencing this organization (e.g., company registration number, DUNS, etc.).

logo.description: An associated logo image for the organization (URL or schema.org ImageObject).

contactPoint.description: Contact point(s) for the organization (schema.org ContactPoint).

sameAs.description: URL(s) referencing official social profiles or external pages for the organization.

image.description: An image that represents the organization (URL string or an ImageObject).

email.description: A general email address for the organization.

telephone.description: A phone number for the organization. Use E.164 or localized format.

foundingDate.description: Date that the organization was founded (YYYY-MM-DD).

parentOrganization.description: The larger organization that this organization is a subOrganization of.

CreativeWorkRef.description: A partial reference to another CreativeWork

name.description: Title of the referenced creative work

ImageObject.description: A schema.org ImageObject with expanded fields

@type.description: Indicates this is a schema.org ImageObject

url.description: A direct link to the image file. Typically the same as contentUrl, but can differ.

height.description: Height of the image in px (number) or a textual measure (e.g., '300px').

width.description: Width of the image in px (number) or a textual measure (e.g., '300px').

contentUrl.description: Actual URL where the image file is hosted. If not provided, 'url' may serve the same purpose.

contentSize.description: File size in bytes or a readable string (e.g., '345 KB').

representativeOfPage.description: Indicates whether this image is representative of the page (e.g., for a primary image).

thumbnail.description: A thumbnail image for this ImageObject (must also be an ImageObject).

exifData.description: EXIF or other metadata for this image, as text or an object referencing details.

oneOf.description: EXIF or metadata in textual form.
Structured exif data object. The schema can be domain-specific or an external reference.

license.description: License information for the image (could be a URL string or a detailed object).

creator.description: Who created this image. Usually a Person or Organization.

name.description: A name for the image if different from 'caption'.

description.description: A short description of this image.

Thing.description: A generic 'Thing' from schema.org, used for 'about' references.

@type.description: E.g. 'Thing' or a more specific type like 'Event', 'Place', etc.
